citing_paper_authors: Ruiqiang, Zhang | Eiichiro, Sumita
raw_text: After analyzing the results presented in the first and second Bakeoffs, (Sproat and Emerson,2003) and (Emerson, 2005), we created a new Chinese word segmentation system named as? Achilles? that consists of four modules mainly: Regular expression extractor, dictionary-based Ngramsegmentation, CRF-based sub word tagging (Zhang et al, 2006), and confidence-based segmentation
clean_text: After analyzing the results presented in the first and second Bakeoffs, (Sproat and Emerson,2003) and (Emerson, 2005), we created a new Chinese word segmentation system named as? Achilles? that consists of four modules mainly: Regular expression extractor, dictionary-based Ngramsegmentation, CRF-based sub word tagging (Zhang et al, 2006), and confidence-based segmentation.

citing_paper_authors: Etienne, Denoual
raw_text: Measuring homogeneity by counting word/ lexeme frequencies introduces additional difficulties as it assumes that the word is an obvious, well-defined unit, which is not the case in the Chinese (Sproat and Emerson 2003) or Japanese language (Matsumoto et al, 2002), for instance, where word segmentation is not trivial
clean_text: Measuring homogeneity by counting word/ lexeme frequencies introduces additional difficulties as it assumes that the word is an obvious, well-defined unit, which is not the case in the Chinese (Sproat and Emerson 2003) or Japanese language (Matsumoto et al, 2002), for instance, where word segmentation is not trivial.

raw_text: caused by segmentation errors in corpora of Bakeoff1 In order to show the impact to the evaluation result caused by EIs existing in test data of Bakeoff1, we conduct the baseline close test with PK and AS corpora ,i.e. we compile lexicons only containing words in their training data and then use the lexicons with a forward maximum matching algorithm to segment their test data respectively (Sproat and Emerson, 2003)
clean_text: In order to show the impact to the evaluation result caused by EIs existing in test data of Bakeoff, we conduct the baseline close test with PK and AS corpora, i.e. we compile lexicons only containing words in their training data and then use the lexicons with a forward maximum matching algorithm to segment their test data respectively (Sproat and Emerson, 2003).

citing_paper_authors: Tetsuji, Nakagawa
raw_text: Segmentation We use three Chinese word-segmented corpora, the Academia Sinica corpus (AS), the Hong Kong City University corpus (HK) and the Beijing University corpus (PK), all of which were used in the FirstInternational Chinese Word Segmentation Bake off (Sproat and Emerson, 2003) at ACL-SIGHAN 2003
clean_text: We use three Chinese word-segmented corpora, the Academia Sinica corpus (AS), the Hong Kong City University corpus (HK) and the Beijing University corpus (PK), all of which were used in the First International Chinese Word Segmentation Bake off (Sproat and Emerson, 2003) at ACL-SIGHAN 2003.

citing_paper_authors: Tetsuji, Nakagawa
